content.description: Easy jamming takes you to a dirty wide crack. Topping out in squeeze chimney style might be the easiest way up.. Bring pants.
content.protection: Bring doubles from BD #2-3 and one each #4-5
content.location: Large obvious crack next to "copyright infringement”.  Route now has its own bolted anchor with rap rings. All hardware is stainless.

climbs.name: Mon Cherie
climbs.fa: Sherrie Dooley, Raleigh Collins, Keith Brueckner

content.description: Face climbing on a part of the crag that gradually narrows with height, until it nearly resembles a tower.

Far left on the lower left shoulder the Truffle Tower formation. This lower face is separated from the main tower by a gully. Exciting face climbing past 4 bolts, between two cracks. Unforntunately this route is very short.

climbs.name: Escargot
climbs.fa: Sherrie Dooley, Raleigh Collins, Keith Brueckner

content.description: Climb the wide face to the right of Mon Cherie.  Not as interesting or as high quality as the other routes in this area.
content.location:
Right of Mon Cherie.  See

photo

climbs.name: Copyright Infringement
climbs.fa: Greg Barnes, Karin Wuhrmann, Paulette Burgess, 3/2003 GU.

content.description: Friction upto the 1st bolt. Climb up the black streak. Small gear in the plates with one good horn to sling before traversing right to the anchors. Good solid rock.
content.protection: 1 bolt, small gear & slings. Gear to 1". Mussey hooks.
content.location: Right of Metro. Look for the single bolt that follows the black streak.
